CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 11, 1945, pg. 15, reads: "Part of the show - Although the Crunkleton Bears played a 0-0 tie with the highly touted Aberdeen (Maryland) Torpedoes at Peabody Field Thanksgiving Day, there were plenty of sideline attractions to keep the spectators entertained. These high-stepping lassies are members of the North Side Elks marching unit. They gave out with an exhibition of baton twirling that almost stole the show. In spite of bad weather, Pittsburghers came out to cheer their favorites on. - Courier Photo by Harris."
TitMainTitle: North Side Elks majorettes marching on Peabody High School football field at 20-yard line
